plugins.name: SPLOC - Selected the parent of component layer
plugins.description:
A plugin for Figma that automatically selects the parent component when any child within the component or its instance is selected.


Main features:

  1. Automatic detection and selection of the parent component
  2. Automatic collapse of the selected component
  3. On/Off switch to enable/disable functionality
  4. Memories the last selection to prevent cyclic selections


How to use:

  1. Install the plugin
  2. Launch the plugin (it is active by default)
  3. Select any element within the component or its instance
  4. The plugin will automatically:
  5. Finds the parent component
  6. Select it
  7. Flattens the structure of the component


Interface:

  1. Compact window with ON/OFF switch
  2. The switch allows you to temporarily disable plugin functionality


Technical features:

  1. Works with components (COMPONENT) and their instances (INSTANCE)
  2. Prevents cyclic selections
  3. Optimized for working with large files
  4. Minimal impact on Figma performance


Application:

Ideal for working with large component systems where switching between children and parent components is often required.


----------------------------------------

plugins.name: Magnetic Snap
plugins.description:
You can align multiple selected objects horizontally or vertically with no gaps (0px spacing).


When aligning horizontally, objects are placed from left to right, and when aligning vertically, objects are placed from top to bottom. Setting a keyboard shortcut allows you to align objects more quickly than setting 0 pixels of space in Auto Layout.

plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!

plugins.name: Frame Flow
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin ‚ÄúFrame Flow‚Äù allows you to duplicate the selected frame to the right or below with a predefined spacing. In addition to duplication, it also lets you insert blank frames at custom intervals. It‚Äôs especially useful when creating presentation documents, as it helps you add pages smoothly without disrupting the layout spacing. Setting up keyboard shortcuts is highly recommended for efficient use.


New Frame

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size.


Add Frame Right

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size to the right of the currently selected frame.

Recommended shortcut: ‚åò + ‚å• (Option) + ‚Üí (Right Arrow)


Add Frame Below

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size below the currently selected frame.

Recommended shortcut: ‚åò + ‚å• (Option) + ‚Üì (Down Arrow)


Duplicate Frame Right

Duplicates the currently selected frame to the right.

Recommended shortcut: ‚åò + ‚å• (Option) + ‚áß (Shift) + ‚Üí (Right Arrow)


Duplicate Frame Below

Duplicates the currently selected frame below.

Recommended shortcut: ‚åò + ‚å• (Option) + ‚áß (Shift) + ‚Üì (Down Arrow)


Settings

Configure various parameters.

plugins.name: Figma to Scabld
plugins.description:
Effortlessly Import Your Figma Designs into Scabld!


Transform your designs into mobile apps in no time with the Scabld plugin for Figma. Seamlessly bring your Figma screens into Scabld and move from design to a fully functional mobile app without any coding required. Our plugin automatically adapts your design to Scabld's no-code platform, so you can focus on turning your vision into reality.


How to use this plugin


1. Install the free Figma plugin.

2. Select your Figma designs.

3. Import them directly into Scabld.

4. Continue editing and customizing just like in Figma.

5. Add interactions and animations.

6. Finalize and publish your mobile app with zero code.


With Scabld, skip the hassle of manual conversions. Simply import your Figma files into our no-code platform and turn them into fully functional mobile apps. We preserve your layer names and design structure, making it easy to pick up where you left off and enhance your creations for a smooth user experience.


Preserve your layer structure.

When you import your designs, all your Figma groups and layer names are kept intact. This allows you to refine, adjust, and polish your app directly in Scabld without losing any important details.


Performance and optimization guaranteed.

When you publish with Scabld, we ensure your mobile app is optimized for peak performance across all devices. Every file is tuned for a fast and smooth experience, providing a high-quality result without compromising speed.


To learn more about Scabld and explore our other features, visit scabld.com.
plugins.tagline: Import your Figma designs into Scabld effortlessly.

plugins.name: TextSwapper
plugins.description:
Features


Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes in Figma.

Quickly update text without needing extra tools.

Streamlined text replacement for multiple objects, components, and frames.

Simple and intuitive interface for seamless integration with your workflow.

Save time ‚è∞ and eliminate the hassle of manually editing text in Figma!

How:


Add the word "page" to the name of your page frame (e.g., agreement_page).

Enter the text you want to replace in the "Find text" field (e.g., {company name}).

Enter the new text in the "Replace with" field (e.g., Figma).

Use the "Update" button to replace the specified line, or the "Update All" button to replace all occurrences of the text in your document.

Use the + and - buttons to adjust the number of text fields.

Click Save to store your list of text replacements for faster updates when working on the same document.

Use Load to retrieve your saved list of text replacements and automatically fill in the fields. The current version retrieves only the latest saved list.

Click Download Selected Pages as PDF to download the selected pages as one merged PDF file.

plugins.name: mdÊ†ºÂºèËΩ¨ËÆæËÆ°Á®ø Markdown to Frame
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows users to convert Markdown text into fully structured Figma frames automatically, enhancing design workflows and documentation processes.


Function Description

The plugin parses Markdown syntax and creates corresponding Figma frames and text elements, supporting headings, lists, bold text, and horizontal rules. It ensures that all content is visually organized according to Markdown structuring.


Usage Method

Simply input your Markdown text into the provided text area in the plugin‚Äôs UI and click the ‚ÄòConvert Markdown‚Äô button. The formatted content will appear as structured frames within your current Figma file.


Note

Ensure all text is properly formatted in Markdown before conversion. The frame width is fixed at 500px, but the height will adjust according to the content.

138054.name: mdÊ†ºÂºèËΩ¨ËÆæËÆ°Á®ø Markdown to Frame
138054.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows users to convert Markdown text into fully structured Figma frames automatically, enhancing design workflows and documentation processes.


Function Description

The plugin parses Markdown syntax and creates corresponding Figma frames and text elements, supporting headings, lists, bold text, and horizontal rules. It ensures that all content is visually organized according to Markdown structuring.


Usage Method

Simply input your Markdown text into the provided text area in the plugin‚Äôs UI and click the ‚ÄòConvert Markdown‚Äô button. The formatted content will appear as structured frames within your current Figma file.


Note

Ensure all text is properly formatted in Markdown before conversion. The frame width is fixed at 500px, but the height will adjust according to the content.

plugins.name: batchy
plugins.description:
batchy is a helper tool to make your exports more comfortable. Instead of just using the layer name and getting the layer size, you will now be able to write your own asset name dynamically with the help of export tokens and choosing between layer size or screen size for your assets.


Features

  1. dynamic asset names with several export tokens like: layers, date, file, scaling, index, user, top-level frame name,
  2. export assets in layer or screen size (top-level frame)
  3. export your current selection
  4. export from an asset list
  5. date formats for your naming
  6. export in common file formats like png, jpg, svg, pdf
  7. multiple files will be downloaded as a zip, single files will be downloaded as single files
  8. OS-proofed asset name support
plugins.tagline: Export your designs with dynamic name behaviors.

plugins.name: Node Exporter
plugins.description:
üß© Node Exporter


Node Exporter is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you extract full or partial JSON data from selected design nodes ‚Äî including all their children ‚Äî with just a click.


‚ú® Features


- üîç Inspect any selected nodes in your Figma file

- üßæ Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ‚úÖ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- üå≥ Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- üíæ Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ‚ö°Ô∏è Fast, no setup, no code required


---


üöÄ How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click ‚Üí Plugins ‚Üí Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `‚ú® Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `üîß Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


üì¶ Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


üîê Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


üß† Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


üë®‚Äçüíª Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
plugins.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children ‚Äî quick, clean, and magical!

plugins.name: Syntax Highlighter
plugins.description:
How to use


Applying syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a code snippet.
  2. Choose a programming language, if required (the plugin will try to identify the language automatically).
  3. Choose a theme.
  4. Toggle include background and line numbers, if required.
  5. Click Apply.


Clearing syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a formatted code snippet.
  2. Click the Clear formatting button.


Adding custom Visual Studio themes


  1. Open Visual Studio Code.
  2. Install the desired color theme and switch to the theme in Visual Studio Code.
  3. Press Ctrl + Shift + P and run Developer: Generate Color Theme from current settings.
  4. Select the file's contents and copy.
  5. Open the Figma plugin and press the Create a new theme button.
  6. Paste into the Create a new theme dialog and click Save.


Note: This plugin supports up to 10 custom themes.

accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

plugins.name: Easy Task Prioritiser
plugins.description:
Easy Task Prioritiser‚Ä®Quickly organize and rank your tasks using two proven prioritization frameworks ‚Äî right inside Figma.


‚ú® How It Works

üî¢ Stack Ranking

Go to the Stack tab.

Enter your list of tasks.

Click Start Comparison to begin.

You‚Äôll be shown two tasks at a time ‚Äî choose which is more important.

Repeat until all tasks are compared and ranked.

In the end:

You'll get a clear, ranked list of tasks

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to bring the list into your Figma file


üß† MoSCoW Prioritization

Switch to the MoSCoW tab.

Add your tasks.

For each task, select whether it‚Äôs a Must, Should, Could, or Won‚Äôt.

Once done, use Push to Canvas to generate a structured visual layout by category.

In the end:

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to see tasks grouped by priority


This plugin is perfect for product teams, designers, and facilitators who want to make prioritization decisions quickly ‚Äî and stay focused on what matters most.

plugins.name: Frame Navigator
plugins.description:
üß≠ FrameNavigator


Effortlessly navigate large and complex Figma files with FrameNavigator ‚Äî a floating Table of Contents plugin that helps you stay organized and move between frames in a single click.


‚ú® Key Features


- Quick Navigation

Instantly jump to any frame from a floating panel that stays visible while you work.


- Custom Frame Registration

Select frames directly on the canvas and add them to your TOC with a simple "+" button.


- Group Organization

Organize your frames into custom groups for better structure and clarity‚Äîperfect for managing multiple screens.


- Flexible Panel Sizes

Choose between default, compact, and full views to match your workflow and screen space.


---


üõ† How It Works


  1. Register a Frame: Select a frame on the Figma canvas and click the `+` button in the plugin to add it to the TOC.
  2. Create a Group: Hover over ungrouped frames in the TOC and click the appearing checkbox to select them. Then click the Create Group button at the top of the panel to group them.
  3. Add to Existing Group: Select a group first, then select a new frame on the canvas and click `+` to add the frame into that group.
  4. Rename a Group: Double-click on a group name to edit it.
  5. Remove a Group: Right-click on a group and select **Remove Group**. ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: All frames inside that group will also be removed from the TOC.
  6. Reorder Frames: Drag and drop frames (or groups) within the TOC to change their order.


---


Perfect for design system creators, large prototyping flows, or anyone managing multi-screen layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly jump between frames with a floating table of contents. Easily build your own TOC.

  4. Rename a Group: Double-click on a group name to edit it.
  5. Remove a Group: Right-click on a group and select **Remove Group**. ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: All frames inside that group will also be removed from the TOC.
  6. Reorder Frames: Drag and drop frames (or groups) within the TOC to change their order.


---


Perfect for design system creators, large prototyping flows, or anyone managing multi-screen layouts in Figma.
129320.tagline: Quickly jump between frames with a floating table of contents. Easily build your own TOC.

plugins.name: Change Variable Descriptions
plugins.description:
Tired of manually updating each Figma variable‚Äôs description? This plugin streamlines the process by allowing you to update all variable descriptions simultaneously using a CSV file. This means you can ensure your design system stays consistent and well-documented‚Äîwithout the hassle of repetitive edits.


How It Works:


‚Ä¢Prepare Your CSV: Create a CSV file with the format: token_name,description. Ensure each variable name in your CSV matches exactly (1:1) with the ones in Figma; the plugin is sensitive to misspellings and will skip any mismatches.

‚Ä¢Select Variable Collection(s): Choose one or multiple variable collections based on your CSV file. (Recommendation: create a separate CSV for each collection.)

‚Ä¢Preview Changes: Review the highlighted changes in a table before applying them, ensuring accuracy and control over the update process.

‚Ä¢Apply Updates: With just a few clicks, update all selected variable descriptions in your Figma design system.


Streamline your design documentation, avoid manual errors, and keep your design tokens up-to-date effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Simplify workflow: Update variable descriptions in one click
